alert.note: Alert for Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 7:36PM EST until further notice by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of west central Indiana, including the following counties, Tippecanoe and Warren. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 PM EST, Emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. - Flooding has been reported in Warren County and along Burnett Creek in Tippecanoe County. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lafayette, West Lafayette, Shadeland, Battle Ground and Purdue University. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
